Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Defilement \De*file"ment\, n. [Cf. F. d['e]filement. See {Defile}] (Mil.) The protection of the interior walls of a fortification from an enfilading fire, as by covering them, or by a high parapet on the exposed side. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Defilement \De*file"ment\, n. [From 3d {Defile}.] The act of defiling, or state of being defiled, whether physically or morally; pollution; foulness; dirtiness; uncleanness. [1913 Webster]
Defilements of the flesh. --Hopkins. [1913 Webster]
The chaste can not rake into such filth without danger of defilement. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
defilement n : the state of being polluted [syn: {befoulment}, {pollution}]
